update.description:
This is highly inspired on SASC rounds, which live in cloudsim-widgets:

#!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/src/a0b023501934088e6e642ca6f8a6988129ea2df6/server/sasc/rounds.js?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default

The objective of having SRC rounds on this server is to minimize the amount of logic which must be handled by the browser. On SASC, the browser is responsible for keeping round data in sync with simulator data. Having this on the portal means that the same `csgrant`  can handle simulators, sshkeys and rounds, so there's less round trips to the browser, the site runs faster, and we have less chances of missing data (like orphan machines which happen often on SASC).

Note that VPN keys still live on the cloudsim-keys server. It would be interesting for this server talk directly to cloudsim-keys to relieve even further the burden on the browser.

This is meant to be non-intrusive, so once SRC is over, we can just remove a couple files.

This is just a suggestion of how we could do it, there are still many holes to be filled, which I marked with TODOs. Feel free to propose a complete redesign.

This pull request adds:

* POST, DELETE and GET routes to create a new SRC round
* Didn't add a PUT route for now because I think it would be nice if we could live without one. That is, all data is generated the moment the round is created, and destroyed when it is deleted. I think this would affect mainly machine state updates, but I might be missing something here.
* Added swagger for convenience (go to /api)
* Added tests
update.title: Beginning of SRC rounds

content.raw: merging this now and will continue work on ssh and vpn gen from here
content.html: merging this now and will continue work on ssh and vpn gen from here

content.raw: Yeah I agree that this looks hacky. Right now, the naming convention I'm adopting is uppercase SRC for teams, lowercase src for the admins (only src-admins), and there is no src-competitors. I'm open to new ideas.
content.html: Yeah I agree that this looks hacky. Right now, the naming convention I'm adopting is uppercase SRC for teams, lowercase src for the admins (only src-admins), and there is no src-competitors. I'm open to new ideas.

content.raw: Maybe we can keep it now in the portal, and when we prove it works more generically, we can promote it to -grant module
content.html: Maybe we can keep it now in the portal, and when we prove it works more generically, we can promote it to -grant module

content.raw: this is iterating over all "src-" identities , and always resulting in variable "team" with the last identity that matched the src- prefix. So are we assuming that the last src- identity will be the team name? (ie. 'src-admins', src-competitors', 'src-team-A')
content.html: this is iterating over all "src-" identities , and always resulting in variable "team" with the last identity that matched the src- prefix. So are we assuming that the last src- identity will be the team name? (ie. 'src-admins', src-competitors', 'src-team-A')

content.raw: Thanks @chapulina , the work looks good. I just did some minor comments. I will also follow these "team" ideas for the bookkeeping work.
content.html: Thanks @chapulina , the work looks good. I just did some minor comments. I will also follow these "team" ideas for the bookkeeping work.

content.raw: maybe 403
content.html: maybe 403

content.raw: Oh yeah I mean terminating them, I'll change the comment
content.html: Oh yeah I mean terminating them, I'll change the comment

content.raw:
Do you mean really deleting simulators? Or just terminating them? 
From what I saw in simulators.js we are keeping old/terminated simulators in database. And that also allows us to compute metrics.
content.html: Do you mean really deleting simulators? Or just terminating them? From what I saw in simulators.js we are keeping old/terminated simulators in database. And that also allows us to compute metrics.

content.raw: Oh nice idea, I should start thinking more in terms of middleware. This could be a nice addition to cloudsim-grant, or maybe we can have one just for the portal?
content.html: Oh nice idea, I should start thinking more in terms of middleware. This could be a nice addition to cloudsim-grant, or maybe we can have one just for the portal?

content.raw: Great point, I'll change to 403s!
content.html: Great point, I'll change to 403s!

content.raw: this block looks like a good candidate for a separate ensureRequiredFields middleware.
content.html: this block looks like a good candidate for a separate ensureRequiredFields middleware.

content.raw: same as above, we could use 403.
content.html: same as above, we could use 403.

content.raw: I suggest replacing this by a 403 error, as this seem to be an authorization error (not authentication). There is a nice SO post here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3297048/403-forbidden-vs-401-unauthorized-http-responses
content.html: I suggest replacing this by a 403 error, as this seem to be an authorization error (not authentication). There is a nice SO post here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3297048/403-forbidden-vs-401-unauthorized-http-responses
